text: Very unprofessional office staff!!!   They talk to you in a very rude manner!  They will disclose your information!  They refused me care knowing the severe allergy issues I was dealing with! name: Julie Evelsizer
text: I contacted Dr. Lee's office on the Internet and asked if they thought I might have an immunological problem, because I was constantly having sinus infections and taking antibiotics all the time. Dr. Lee wrote me back the next morning and said to make an appointment, which I did, and got in very quickly. Dr. Lee tested my blood thoroughly and found that I had never developed immunity to Hemophilus Influenza B. He gave me the vaccine for it, and my sinus infections have been few and far between in all the years since. I liked him a lot instantly and was impressed with his knowledge.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review Ms. Evelsizer.  I appreciate  your trust in me very much and am so glad to hear that you have been doing better.  Stay well!

name: anm1980
text: Dr. Lee is the best doctor I’ve ever seen my whole life and I’ve lived all around the US! I may not be a doctor myself but I’m very educated when it comes to healthcare. I look up the ratings of every doctor I see and I am constantly researching the latest healthcare options. I have been seeing doctors a lot lately for health issues and since I research so much, I typically come across doctors that haven’t heard of some of the latest research at National Institutes of Health or institutions like this. Well Doctor Lee not only always knows what I’m talking about but he knows it in so much detail that I just shut up and listen lol he has helped me through so much! I went from having high and low immunoglobulin levels (antibodies) to having normal levels. He tested me in detail and looked at every step of my immune system. Not only is he a great immunologist but he is a great doctor in every category 😂 I seriously asked him something that is not his specialty (Gastrointestinal issues) and he helped me more than the Gastroenterologist I see did... I may sound overly excited to talk about him but I’m just so happy somewhere like Montgomery has a doctor like him! I refer everyone to him... friends family and everyone.. hopefully he doesn’t get overly booked because this could back fire on me lol

name: google user
text: Dr. Lee is a great Allergist! He really does care about his patients. Its been years since Ive been to him but when my daughter Stephanie W. was about 5, she was diagnosed with RRP. She was seeing Dr. Lee for allergies at the time. Because of the RRP she was going through so many surgeries. She had about 38 when she started going to him. Dr. Lee was curious what this virus was that was causing her condition. So unrelated to the allergies he started studying her condition. He came up with a theory that her T and B cells were very low and that she was born that way that is why she could not fight a virus that everyone has in their bodies from birth. He came up with a special formula of different immunizations that targeted boosting these cells. Instead of needing surgery every 6 weeks it went to every 6 months. Within 2 years she was free of RRP. We have never been able to or thought of thanking Dr. Lee for his research and help. But if I could talk to him today I would give him a big hug! He helped cure my daughter and I owe him so much for that!!! Really he is a great great Dr. If you want one that cares, go see Dr. Lee. He won't do you wrong.

name: Janie Kirkpatrick
text: I watched as the woman at the desk told my niece if you don’t pay your daughter will not get her shots today!  I understand a business has to receive payment, but there are circumstances that are occurring in her life that she has no control over at the time.  My niece is a single mother and doing a great job if I might add!  Her ex is not helping her at all and her insurances are in limbo. In fact he is making it as difficult as he can by preventing her from getting an insurance that would cost her less... Instead of working with my niece the receptionist did this in front other patients that were in the office.  This same receptionist had called my niece at her place of employment demanding payment.  Is this not called haressment?  Common sense tells you if you have a single mother working trying to keep her daughter healthy and you as a health provider can make that happen wouldn’t you make sure all your patients were taken care of? My niece came back to sit down after paying the small amount of 250.00 and couldn’t even talk because she was so upset and crying! She is paying almost full price for each shot her daughter receives.  I looked up at the receptionist that had NO regret or expression for doing this at all!  I wondered if anyone else had had this experience with this well known place business.  Please let this review make it better not worst for all the patients Alabama Allergy serves!

name: Shandah
text:
The Trussville location is wonderful. I had an appointment there for the first time about a month ago (my next appointment, which was confirmed after a call to remind me of my appointment by Cynthia - the receptionist, is at the end of this week). I have had some issues for a few years, but I had not been tested for allergies. I am thankful first for friends who listen and give great advice, and also for Dr. Massey and the great nurses and receptionist at the Trussville location. Thank the Lord for some relief. I still have to make sure that I will not have to take the allergy shots, but I am hoping that all of this can be resolved - at least I am getting relief from years of coughing, unable to sleep, and taking medication that worked for a moment and then did not work anymore (because all of my issues were not being address).

I want to thank Dr. Massey and the team at the Trussville location for being patient and hearing my entire story to help figure out what is going on with me. I really wish the best for all at this location.

Again, Thank you.
Shandah aka Hopeful Patient

He put me on an inhaler that basically made me feel like I was receiving no treatment at all. I went back to my pediatrician because I was still a young teenager at the time and he came up with a plan to help get my Asthma more under control. I am now on the highest level of the maintenance inhaler that I take. My Asthma is quite severe. I do not recommend this doctor. He was a nice guy, horrible doctor.

text: My daughter is almost 2 years old. Her pediatrician referred us to Dr. Meadows to get allergy tested. She has severe Eczema, and we also think she has a dairy allergy or another allergy. So we get to the appointment and wait. For 90 minutes. Just for Dr. Meadows to walk in, look at her, and say "she has eczema. she doesn't need to be allergy tested." Umm. Excuse me?? She was referred here to specifically get the testing done, so your opinion does not matter. He said you can put her in a bubble and her skin will still look like that. Ok? But you can also pour milk on her and she will immediately turn red and start itching?? So his response was just that it was a reaction that flared up the Eczema. Needless to say my Pediatrician is furious and has referred us to someone else. I would not use this Doctor at all. His staff is very rude and does not care at all about your problems, or your child's apparently. If you want better service try Dr. Lee.

text: I highly recommend Southern ENT & Dr Walters. Likes: Website has printable new patient forms that I completed before my appointment. Comfortable waiting area. Once I got to the exam room, I was seen right away. First by the friendly, efficient & knowledgeable auditory tech who took me to the sound-proof room for testing. I was pleasantly surprised that there was no wait time between testing & meeting with Dr Walters to review my results. Five stars for Dr Walters! It was obvious that he had reviewed my paperwork in advance,. He explained my results, answered my questions, and recommended a course of action clearly & patiently. I felt like he was seeing me as a person, not as a condition. Why not 5 stars? 40-minute wait time before getting to exam room & inability to complete & submit patient forms online.

He was able to pop it back in place for immediately relief. I was very happy with my visit here and everyone on the staff is extremely helpful and nice! I recommend anyone to go here!

name: Lisa Phillips
text: Dr. Benoit is a very good ENT Specialist. His concern and care about what I was dealing with made me feel so at ease under his care. He is very thorough with giving your diagnosis and prognosis. I was clear about everything that he was going to do for me before any procedure was done. The thing that really made my heart overjoyed was when he personally called to check up on me after my procedure. I've never ever had a doctor to take that kind of time out of their busy day to personally call me, and for me, that is what has left a lasting impression on me. I told my family and friends about that and they were amazed, so thank you Dr. Benoit and staff for taking excellent care of me. You will always be my ENT Specialist and who I will refer all my family and friends to. Thanks again!!

Dr. Gordon Shields is an excellent ENT. He demonstrated great rapport with me on my first visit so I knew he was going to be a good fit for me. During every visit, he walks in, immediately greets me, and shakes my hand. He addresses all my concerns.

Recently, he performed minor surgery on me in his office and did an excellent job. Anesthesia was used and I had no pain or side effects. He is very competent and professional.

name: Sibyl Fondren
text:
I'd been plagued with monthly sinus infections with intense pressure and pain for over a year.  During that time I saw 3 different ENTs without any long term change.  I had tried the prescribed sinus irrigation, Flonase, countless rounds of antibiotics etc. to the point I was living on decongestants to get any relief.
Dr. Benoit was the first to suggest taking a CT scan. He listened to my history and seemed to genuinely want to help me find relief. He showed me the CT scan and explained how my deviated septum and enlarged turbinates were swelling and causing not only pain but blockage which wasn't allowing mucus out or helpful medications in! He suggested a septoplasty with turbinate reduction.
My surgery was November 16, 2016 and I have had continually improving symptoms.  I have yet to have a sinus infection, I can breathe freely through both nostrils (something I never realized I couldn't do!), clearing my sinuses is a breeze now and my Flonase can actually get where it needs to go!

A huge thanks to Dr. Benoit and his friendly, efficient staff! I couldn't imagine an easier experience or a better outcome!

text: Made an appointment at the Grandview office of ENT Associates and after 2 hours in this office, I left without any treatment or conclusion in regards to my visit. Upon leaving ENT associates I was under the impression that of 24 years of age I was suffering from tinnitus, as well as needed to consider a nose job for my allergy problems. Now after one day of being treated by the local doc in the box, I feel 100 times better. Who knew it was rocket science to take .000005 seconds to look into someone's ear and see fluid, and then connect the dots. 0/10 for ENT Associated at Grandview, don't waste your time.

text: Our appt for allergy testing on a three year old was at 9:45. It is now 1:20 in the afternoon and we are still waiting. An hour in the waiting area beyond our appt time, over an hour sitting waiting for the doctor and no sign of him coming back in to tell us results.

text: When I go to the office everyone very nice to me. If I have questions about my asthma or allergies or sinus they will help me figure it out

name: Jennifer Lee
text: My daughter was a new patient.  I use the word was because we had to sit in the car a hour passed her appointment time. The nurse kept telling me that they had no rooms open.  But even when they call to check to see if we was coming they had 2 times before her appointment  open. This is a very bad 1st impression for a new patient.  We just left. How would they like to sit in the car for over a hour ? If you can't make the time for the appointment then why make them? Not going back thats for sure.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that you had this experience. Currently due to COVID we are experiencing delays due to screening patients outdoors, room sanitization, and trying to keep patients in the waiting room to a minimum to reduce exposure as Alabama continues to see COVID cases.  Currently we are only seeing new and allergy testing patients in the office and doing telemedicine at the end of the day. We will take this into serious consideration and try to improve our workflow.

name: Suki T
text: Dr Kalenian is an amazing doctor, a doctor who actually cares for his patients. He has literally saved my life. He recognized that I could have a rare disease and made sure I got the testing necessary to be diagnosed one way or the other. He wouldn’t have recognized all of the signs of this disease if he didn’t take the time to listen to my explanations of what had been going on instead of just trying to rush me through. I thought I had just developed new terrible allergies, but he recognized it was more. He helped me get proper testing, get referrals and followed up on all of these things. I have since been diagnosed with a the very rare diseases suspected and am doing a lot better because of being on the right treatments for the disease. Without these treatments I would likely be deceased by now. I will forever be thankful to Dr Kalenian and his staff.

name: Robert Joslin
text: We have known Dr. Kalenian for a very  long time. Dr. Kalenian has been always caring, is never rushed with his patients, is honest and listens to his patients. We first went to him in the late 90s, and were  referred to him by the late Dr. James Sullivan and he really helped both me and my wife with our severe allergies. We greatly appreciate him, wishing all the best after his car accident recently.

Dr. Kalenian and staff makes you feel more like family than a patient and I highly recommend Alabama Asthma and Allergy!

name: Ami Denault
text: They goof around with random meds that actually actually made me extremely sick. Then they procrastinated refilling my meds for two months. After playing tag for that long I decided to change doctors.

resp.text: Thanks for your concerns as we value them and sorry for any inconvenience you may have experienced. We have been providing good service to you for many years, carefully investigated your issue and have a paper trail on file after calling your pharmacy that we received a fax refill request from the pharmacy after you picked up your prescription which the pharmacy told us to then ignore. If there are any issues with any worker we would kindly appreciate that you would promptly contact our management team first with suggestions for improvement so that we can better quickly rectify any situation to your satisfaction and better help others.  However, thank you for your comments as we greatly appreciate all of our patients comments and concerns and keep them all under serious consideration. Sincerely, AAAPC staff

name: Dia Crawford
text: I love Dr Kalanien and his staff! The really listen to you and make you feel like they value you. They understand that you know your body best and talk to you, listen and work with you to provide the best treatment for you. They will always follow up on calls and even Dr Kalanien will call you at home and discuss your issues with you. They don't hurry you through and they work with you. I have improved greatly with my breathing under their care and look forward to my visits. They are genuine caring individuals. Now that I have such a caring doctor and his staff I look forward to enjoying a better quality of life. Please do yoirself a favor and visit them. You won't be sorry and your life will never be the same. It will be much better!!!

name: A Person
text: They need another day in Enterprise. Dothan is open for 4 days and Enterprise is only open on Tuesdays. It makes it much harder for me to get allergy shots when you have to do it on one certain day. Waits are long, the staff got worse and several other things. Although they try to get people in. It's just extremely angering when it's opened 1 time a week in a town with 30,000 residents.

resp.text: Thanks you for your suggestions.  We have looked at this before, and currently our doctor is the only board certified allergist who comes to Enterprise with a population of 30,000. Dothan's population is 120,000 outside the circle and a city typically has to have a population  of 50,000 to fully support a specialist. Our caring physician comes to Enterprise mainly out of loyalty to military personnel and their dependents since he himself is a former military doctor and decorated war veteran of Desert Storm. Other specialties like cardiology typically come to Enterprise on a limited basis as well. We invite you to come to our Dothan office where there is more flexibility with scheduling shots and visits and we are open there on  Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays. We however will keep your suggestions under serious consideration and do appreciate your comments and concerns. Sincerely, AAAPC Staff

text: My cousin drives all the way from Atlanta to get her hearing aids adjusted! She loves Jennifer

name: Zachariah Kesterson
text: I have suffered from sinus issues and infections for over 25 years. I have seen other specialists. Dr. Robertson is by far the best ENT I have ever been treated by. Dr. Robertson and his people are so kind and thorough. After a hearing test, an allergy test and catscan he discovered my sinuses were blocked with little to no openings in the passages. The surgery was scheduled quickly and the care was fantastic. The recovery was not bad at all. I have never felt better in my life. I can finally breathe through my nose with no obstruction, and I am not getting a sinus infection every month anymore. My family can even tell a difference in my mood. The surgery has been life changing. If you need ENT care, Dr. Robertson and his people are incredible.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: We are so glad you are feeling good! Thank you for coming to see us!

text: That want to charge you for appointment if you have to cancel, but they can't get you back to see the doctor at your appointment time. Always 20-30 behind. Also it seems they just want to upsell services.

resp.text: We are so sorry about this. We actually do not charge for canceling an appointment, just for a “no show”. We are working on improving our scheduling, so that the wait time is minimal.

text: You need an ENT he is the best and the staff is very professional help me so much

text: Staff is very friendly. Dr Robertson takes time to explain everything to me. I had surgery to open sinuses and it is amazing the difference. I feel very confident in the care I've received there.

text: Dr Robertson did 2 surgeries on me, one to repair my deviated septum, the second on my sinuses. He did a great job! He is a very good ENT surgeon!!

name: Independent thinker
text:
Went in, thought I had bad allergy, was told by Dr Robertson I was allergic to  everything but mold and mildew. I had a bad feeling about it then. He suggested surgery to get air moving, idiot like I agreed. I could tell no difference after healing, didn't approach my original problem. I feel he wanted to pad his pocket at my expense.
I went to another Doctor, he didn't do the age old skin prick test, he drew blood and sent it off to be tested. Came back I was allergic to dogs only and just enough to register on the test it was so slight. Said I will probably have to have surgery to get it straight. Dr Robertson didn't do the job right.  He only did part of the job needed, why would he not do the whole job and not put someone through all that again?
GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!

name: Breunca Meadows
text: My experience started off good and went horribly wrong from there. Working in the health field I've learned that a patients health history pays a vital key in treatment. I show up to my 5:45 appointment for my surgery apparently no one from the nurses to the doctor reviewed my medical history which stated that I was anemic . After being prepped for my surgery I was then told that I wouldn't be having the surgery due to me being anemic. Which was stated that same day more than once to two different people. On top of wasting my time, including the week that I had already taken time off from work which was now a waste, I was told that I could  call back in two - three months once I was "cleared" to have the surgery! I wouldn't recommended to anyone who has any type of predisposed health issue.

resp.text: We are so sorry for the inconvenience.  We always put our patient's safety first.  Unfortunately, safety concerns can arise at any time.  Please give us a call if you have any additional questions.  Thank you!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Dr. Robertson changed my life! I visited him after hearing a radio commercial about balloon sinuplasty, and I was skeptical at first but after years and years of chronic sinus problems, I was desperate to try anything. Dr. Robertson was very warm & personable, and I could tell he really cares. Most doctors I've met are sort of callous, and it's hard to find one that'll talk to you like a real person. Kudos to Dr. Robertson for making me feel comfortable about this, because it's a lot to consider & a lot of money. I elected to go with the procedure, and I'm so glad that I did. I can breathe so much better now, I'm sleeping better, and I'm no longer constantly bothered by my sinuses throughout the day. I'm not breathing perfectly, of course, but I can definitely feel a significant improvement. I think as long as you're nor expecting rainbows & unicorns but can keep your expectations reasonable, you'll be satisfied. If I could go back in time, I would have the procedure again. Thank you Dr. Robertson!

name: JP
text: Dr. Robertson is a great doctor.  The best ENT in Birmingham. Dr. Robertson performed sinus surgery on me back in 1998. I was having severe miagrane headaches that would last for days.  After surgery I felt 100% better. I was amazed at the result. Also Dr. Robertson does NOT pack your sinuses after surgery. Today I'm still doing great and haven't had any other problems with my sinuses.

name: becky patterson
text: First time I got relief with my sinuses!

resp.text: We are glad you are feeling well!

name: Deana Mumpower
text:
I have had chronic sinus infections  for years.  My ears felt stopped up which was affecting my hearing.  Dr Robertson found the problem.  He suggested balloon  sinuplasty.  This has enabled my sinuses to drain properly and has alleviated  constant sinusitis. This procedure also opened my  ears.
The balloon sinuplasty  helped me so much, I took my mother (90) to see Dr Robertson.  She has had constant sinus problems for years.  Dr Robertson suggested the same procedure.  She is having great results, also.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
Dr. Robertson is absolutely amazing. I originally went in to see him about sinus issues that were making me miserable. He suggested that I undergo allergy testing. I did and my results revealed that I was allergic to 90% of what I was tested for, and I was severely allergic to most of those. I have started Rush Immunology and I look forward to feeling better in the future! Due to my anatomy (as found on CT Scan) Dr. Robertson recommended surgical intervention, and he performed a Septoplasty on me as well as addressed several other sinus-related issues during the procedure. Yes, post-op pn is never fun, but I am hoping to reap the benefits of the surgery in the near future.
I cannot thank Dr. Robertson enough as he has been so knowledgeable and helpful in explaining exactly what he feels is going on with my allergy and sinus issues. When I first met him, he came in and sat down and took plenty of time speaking with me...even after being in a long day of surgery. He is never rushed in my appts, and spends a good amount of time explaining things. His staff has also been so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable as well. I appreciate Dr. Robertson and his awesome staff more than they will ever know! Thank you ALL so very much!!!
(*FYI regarding another review below, the blood test used for allergy testing is NOT AT ALL considered to be the most effective at finding accurate results; research this)
